ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Music 820 has the ambitious goal of placing mostly western feminist and gender theory in conversation with ethnographies on a wide array of cultures. I would recommend this course to another student, but advise that they should be prepared to do outside research on the music discussed in each ethnography in order to have a foundation upon which to base their discussion.
This course outlines some basic gender theory before exploring ethnographic writings that have included and/or emphasized gender as part of their musical study.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me some insight into the types of questions ethnomusicologists ask. In this way, it was valuable for me to start to get a sense of the field.

It gave wide exposure to a number of ethnographic writings and revealed some ways in which ethnomusicologists have successfully included considerations of gender and difference in their musical scholarship.
